alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:01AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wilcox County through 830 AM CDT... At 801 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Magnolia, or 14 miles northeast of Thomasville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Wilcox County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
